1.text: Despite the fact that Vesta has no clouds or snow cover, it is the brightest object in the asteroid belt with an albedo about the same as the Earth.

2.text: About 1 in every 20 meteorites that fall to the Earth come from Vesta.

3.text: When it was first discovered in 1807 Vesta was thought to be a moon of its larger cousin, Ceres, which was initially designated a planet.

1.text: The pink dragon millipede spits flammable liquid onto its prey, which in the hot sun may actually combust.

2.text: The ruby seadragon uses its bright red color as camouflage.

3.text: The blue dragon sea slug spends most of its life floating upside down on the ocean surface, it feeds on Portuguese man o’ wars, and steels their venom for their own defence.

1.text: Scientists have successfully tested a coal combustion process that extracts energy from  coal without burning it while capturing 99% of the carbon dioxide produced.

2.text: A new study finds that eye injuries from laser pointers have been increasing, with over 500 reported cases in 2012 in the US.

3.text: A recent analysis of published English-language books shows a steady trend toward decreasing use of emotional words throughout the 20th century.

1.text: Astronomers have observed a superflare from our Sun, 10 times as powerful as the Carrington event, although safely pointed away from the Earth.

2.text: Astronomers report that confirmation of 7 exoplanets with periods greater than 15 years, the longest greater than 40 years.

3.text: New measurements find that while Mercury’s outer core is molten, its inner core is solid and about the same size as Earth’s

1.text: The Spix macaw, made famous by the 2011 movie Rio, was declared extinct in the wild in 2018, with the only remaining specimens in captivity.

2.text: The eastern cougar was declared extinct in 2018, even though the last sighting was 80 years ago.

3.text: The last living northern white rhino died in captivity in 2018.

1.text: MIT engineers present a new neural network computer chip that is up to 7 times faster and uses 95% less energy than an equivalent conventional digital chip.

2.text: A new study finds that couples where either partner drinks one or more sugar-sweetened beverage per day have a decreased chance of getting pregnant.

3.text: An analysis of the last 25 years of data shows that safe-sleep recommendations have not decreased the rate of sudden infant death in the neonatal period.
